business.headline: Mutual fund boom in India: Guess what's fuelling the Rs 65 lakh crore surgeMumbai alone leads the chart, contributing 27% (Rs 17.75 lakh crore), followed by Delhi at 12.63%, Bengaluru at 5.39%, Pune at 4%, and Kolkata at 3.49%. These numbers haven't changed much since last year, according to data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI).

Sensex down over 600 points: Why is stock market falling today?Stock markets have now traded in a narrow range for three consecutive sessions, with investors appearing to take a breather after a record-breaking rally earlier this month.

Is the defence stock party over? Here's what investors need to knowShares of Paras Defence and Cochin Shipyard dropped more than 6% each during the day. The broader Nifty India Defence index was also down.

Lost your UAN? Here's a step-by-step guide to get it back in minutesYour UAN is more than just a number. Without your UAN, you can't check your PF balance, update your account, or even withdraw money when you need it.

Paras Defence, Cochin Shipyard: Why these defence stocks tumbled over 6% todayLeading the slide were Paras Defence, Cochin Shipyard. Both fell over 6% in intraday trade. The broader Nifty India Defence index dropped 1.4% to around 11:50 am, marking its second straight day of decline after a blistering multi-week rally.

ITR checklist: Who must file, deadlines, documents and the truth about 'zero tax'In the 2025–26 Union Budget, the government gave a big relief, i.e., no tax on income up to Rs 12 lakh under the new tax regime. But here's the catch: You must file your ITR to claim it.

Explained: Why Protean eGov shares are in free fallAfter crashing 20% on Monday, the stock fell another 13% in early trade, briefly hovering near the Rs 995 mark—perilously close to its 52-week low of Rs 930.
Pfizer share price rises 12% today. Here's whyPfizer stock: The stock jumped 11.91% during the day to touch a high of Rs 4,995.85 on the stock exchanges, after starting the day at Rs 4,698.80.

Explained: How Bangladesh is hurting itself by curbing Indian exportsIndia's new import rules sharply limit Bangladesh's access through Northeast land ports, forcing key goods onto restricted sea routes. The move comes after Bangladesh imposed similar restrictions on Indian goods.

Forget crypto, gold and stocks: Why India's ultra-rich are buying landA luxury real estate advisor has said that India's top 0.001%, from unicorn founders to legacy dynasties, are quietly building Rs 75–500 crore portfolios, but not in stocks or crypto. Their focus is on land and branded real estate.
Sensex opens 150 points up, Nifty below 25,000; Tata Steel gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 150.58 points to 82,210.00, while the NSE Nifty50 added 20.45 points to 24,965.90 as of 9:25 am.

Borana Weaves IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe company aims to raise Rs 144.89 crore through a fresh issue of 67 lakh shares. Borana Weaves IPO will remain open for three days and will close on Thursday, May 22, 2025.

entertainment.headline: Actor slams reporter for question on her sleeveless outfit, slams media silenceA woman anchor called out a reporter who questioned her attire at a film event and criticised the media's silence. She said such incidents affected her mentally and questioned the ethics of the film press.

K-pop groups TWICE, ENHYPEN, and BTS set for comebacks in 2025The second quarter of 2025 is shaping up to be a rollercoaster for K-pop fans—with groups like TWICE, ENHYPEN making a comeback and BTS all set to reunite after completing their mandatory military service.

Operation Khukri: Randeep Hooda to lead as Major General Punia in war dramaRandeep Hooda will star as Major General Raj Pal Punia in 'Operation Khukri', a war drama based on the Indian Army's daring 2000 rescue mission in Sierra Leone. The film highlights the bravery of 233 Indian soldiers trapped for 75 days in enemy territory.

Singer Shannon says 'didn't take' father Kumar Sanu's help: Had my own journeyShannon K has successfully established herself as an independent artist, performing at Coachella and contributing to the Cannes film 'Tanvi The Great'. She credits hard work to nepotism and aims to inspire young Indian musicians worldwide.

I'm a citizen too: Ridhi Dogra after being bullied for opposing Abir Gulaal releaseActor Ridhi Dogra recently revealed that she was bullied on social media for opposing her film 'Abir Gulaal's' release following the Pahalgam terror attack.

Ulaganayagan to Vinveli Nayaga: Kamal Haasan on Thug Life, death and legacyKamal Haasan is upbeat about his upcoming film, 'Thug Life', which marks his reunion with Mani Ratnam 37 years after their iconic 'Nayakan'. In a chat with India Today, he spoke in detail about the film, among several other topics.

Denzel Washington receives honorary Palme d'Or at Cannes: Blessed beyond measureHollywood actor Denzel Washington received the prestigious Honorary Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival during the premiere of his new film 'Highest 2 Lowest'.

Tom Cruise hints at end of Mission Impossible The Final ReckoningTom Cruise has hinted that 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning' could mark the end of the iconic franchise. The new title and his recent comments have fuelled speculation about Ethan Hunt's final mission.

Paresh Rawal quit Hera Pheri 3 over fee demand, tiff with Akshay Kumar: SourcesParesh Rawal demanded Rs 25 crore for his role as Babu Rao Apte in 'Hera Pheri 3', following which he made an exit from the franchise. This irked Akshay Kumar, who has now decided to take legal action against him.

War 2 teaser: No mercy, only guns do the talking in Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR's film'War 2' teaser starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR was released on May 20. The film, directed by Ayan Mukerji, will release in theatres on August 14.

Did Shraddha Kapoor quit Rahi Anil's film over Rs 17 crore fee? Director reactsReports claim Shraddha Kapoor exited director Rahi Anil Barve's upcoming thriller film produced by Ekta Kapoor after allegedly demanding a Rs 17 crore fee. However, director Barve dismissed these claims as mere rumours.

Janhvi Kapoor's boyfriend Shikhar, sister Khushi become her cheerleaders at CannesActor Janhvi Kapoor is set to walk the Cannes red carpet for her film 'Homebound' screening. Ahead of the grand appearance, the actor received a shout-out from her squad, who accompanied her to the French Riviera.

Raid 2 box office: Ajay's film hits Rs 200 crore worldwide, 2nd after ChhaavaAjay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has entered the Rs 200 crore club at the worldwide box office. The film has also breached the Rs 150 crore nett mark back home. It is only the second Bollywood film this year after 'Chhaava' to have achieved the feat.

Priyanka Chopra rocks beige outfit at Italy event with Lisa and Liu YifeiPriyanka Chopra looked gorgeous in a beige outfit as she attended the Bulgari event with Blackpink's Lisa and Liu Yifei. Several photos from the event have gone viral.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 3: Tom Cruise's film sees big drop on MondayWhile 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' opened on a strong note at the Indian box office on Saturday, the film saw a huge drop on its first Monday. It is still looking at gathering solid numbers towards the second weekend.

Sharmila Tagore, Simi Garewal attend Cannes screening of Ray's Aranyer Din RatriVeteran actors Sharmila Tagore and Simi Garewal attended the screening of Satyajit Ray's iconic film, 'Aranyer Din Ratri.' The pictures of the two walking the red carpet with the team have gone viral.

Rajamouli recommends Tourist Family after a glowing review. Director reactsDirector SS Rajamouli showered appreciation on the Tamil film, 'Tourist Family', starring Sasikumar and Simran. Debutant director Abishan Jeevinth was over the moon after the 'RRR' director called his film the best cinematic experience of the year.

Tamil actors Vishal, Sai Dhanshika announce wedding in AugustTamil actors Vishal and Sai Dhanshika made their relationship official at 'Yogi Da' event in Chennai on Monday. The two will get married in August.

'Sesame Street' heads to Netflix while staying on PBSSesame Street will stream new and classic episodes on Netflix later this year, while continuing its run on PBS. Season 56 will feature shorter, story-driven episodes and fresh visual updates.

general news.headline: Trinamool names Abhishek Banerjee for Op Sindoor delegation after Yusuf Pathan rowAfter Yusuf Pathan opted out of the Operation Sindoor delegation, the Trinamool Congress today named Abhishek Banerjee as its representative.

Pak's ISI was using 'spy' Haryana YouTuber to identify Indian agents: SourcesYouTuber Jyoti Malhotra is being interrogated by the National Investigation Agency, Intelligence Bureau and Haryana Police for her alleged involvement in cross-border influence operations.

Supreme Court hears petitions challenging Waqf law, may pass interim orderWaqf law hearing: It was decided in the last hearing that only five leading petitions would be heard from among the raft of pleas filed against the law, which expands the government's role in regulating Waqf properties.

Top Army officer says India can strike all of Pak: They'll need deep hole to hideThe entire territory of Pakistan is within India's strike range, and if the Pakistani Army relocates its headquarters, it would need to find a very deep hole to hide, a top Indian Army officer underscored India's military prowess.

Why Yunus govt, Bangladesh Islamists can't kill Awami LeagueThe Awami League, banned by Muhammad Yunus' interim government, isn't a political party but a cult. Outlawed thrice in the past, the party sprang back to life each time, and commands a 40% vote share. It is the inheritor of Mujibur Rahman's legacy, whose life is integral to Bangladesh's freedom struggle, and Bengali nationalism. This is why Islamists or Yunus won't be able to sink the AL boat.
Landslide on Kailash Yatra route, hundreds of pilgrims strandedThe landslide has blocked the route completely due to which both locals and pilgrims are stranded.

Golden Temple gave rare go-ahead to deploy guns to counter Pak drones: OfficerIn an unprecedented move, the chief religious official of the Golden Temple permitted the Indian Army to deploy air defence systems within the shrine's premises to counter Pakistani drone and missile attacks amid India's Operation Sindoor.
What's behind the sudden spike of Covid-19 cases in Asia?Covid-19 cases have surged in several Asian countries, including Hong Kong, Singapore, and Thailand. India, however, reports a mild increase.

Ex-actor reveals Harvey Weinstein's 'monster side': Took erectile shot, raped meIn her testimony, Jessica Mann narrated how her consensual relationship with disgraced Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein spiralled into instances of rape.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Microsoft engineer interrupts CEO keynote, says company is killing PalestiniansAt the Microsoft Build event on Monday, an engineer from the company interrupted CEO Satya Nadella during his keynote speech, saying, "Satya, how about you show how Microsoft is killing Palestinians?". The employee was immediately escorted out of the event.
'Spy' YouTuber established contacts up to 'terror hub' Pak-Afghan borderJyoti Malhotra, a Haryana-based travel vlogger, is among 11 people who have been arrested on charges of spying for Pakistan.

Paresh Rawal quit Hera Pheri 3 over fee demand, tiff with Akshay Kumar: SourcesParesh Rawal demanded Rs 25 crore for his role as Babu Rao Apte in 'Hera Pheri 3', following which he made an exit from the franchise. This irked Akshay Kumar, who has now decided to take legal action against him.

How India will bypass Bangladesh roads and roadblocksAfter Bangladeshi interim leader Muhammad Yunus referred to India's "landlocked" Northeast during a China visit, New Delhi responded by restricting Bangladeshi exports and fast-tracking alternative connectivity plans for the Northeast, bypassing Bangladesh. The key to that is the Kaladan Multi-Modal Transit Project, which will link Kolkata with Mizoram via Myanmar.

Sensex down over 600 points: Why stock market is falling todayStock markets have now traded in a narrow range for three consecutive sessions, with investors appearing to take a breather after a record-breaking rally earlier this month.

Meet the 3 IPS officers probing Minister's remarks against Col Sofiya QureshiThe three-member SIT team includes IPS officers Pramod Verma, Kalyan Chakravarty and Vahini Singh. They will investigate Madhya Pradesh Minister Vijay Shah's controversial remarks against Colonel Sofiya Qureshi.

Ulaganayagan to Vinveli Nayaga: Kamal Haasan on Thug Life, death and legacyKamal Haasan is upbeat about his upcoming film, 'Thug Life', which marks his reunion with Mani Ratnam 37 years after their iconic 'Nayakan'. In a chat with India Today, he spoke in detail about the film, among several other topics.

Bengaluru rain: Elderly man, 12-year-old boy electrocuted in flooded apartmentFollowing heavy rains in Bengaluru, two people died in the BTM Layout area while trying to clear waterlogging in their apartment complex. A 35-year-old woman died in Whitefield after a compound wall collapsed.

3-year law practice mandatory to join judicial service: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court reinstated the requirement of a minimum of three years of legal practice for candidates applying for entry-level judicial posts, noting that the lack of practical experience among judges has led to various issues.

Forget crypto, gold and stocks: Why India's ultra-rich are buying landA luxury real estate advisor has said that India's top 0.001%, from unicorn founders to legacy dynasties, are quietly building Rs 75–500 crore portfolios, but not in stocks or crypto. Their focus is on land and branded real estate.

Bengaluru man shares pic of ankle-deep water inside car after heavy rainAs heavy rains left Bengaluru waterlogged yet again, a viral photo of a flooded car footwell summed up the frustration of a city stretched thin.

Bengaluru man's Rs 50 lakh notice to civic body for 'trauma' due to poor roadsA 43-year-old Bengaluru man has served BBMP a legal notice seeking Rs 50 lakh compensation for physical and emotional trauma allegedly caused by poorly maintained roads. He linked his health issues to daily commutes.

No booze, no cigarettes: China orders officials to cut costs amid economic strainThe effort is being seen as a measure by Xi Jinping and the Communist party to improve the economic conditions and reduce stress on the government's finances.

Hand over Hafiz Saeed, things will be over: Indian diplomat's message to PakIndia's envoy to Israel says Operation Sindoor is paused, not over. He urges Pakistan to extradite 26/11 terrorists and warns that cross-border terror will be met with continued offensive action.

sports.headline: Indian selectors undecided about Test captaincy after Gill, Pant talks: ReportAccording to a latest report from Sky Sports, the Indian selection committee is still undecided about whom to name as the new Test captain after holding informal talks with both Shubman Gill and Rishabh Pant.

Ballon d'Or winner Kaka eager to join Ancelotti's Brazil coaching staffFormer Ballon d'Or winner Kaka has expressed his interest in joining Carlo Ancelotti's coaching staff for the Brazil national team, stating he's ready to serve his country again as the five-time champions prepare for a new era under the Italian.

SRH gave their best batting performance in LSG win: Coach Daniel VettoriSunrisers Hyderabad head coach Daniel Vettori heaped praise on his team's batting performance in their win over Lucknow Super Giants on May 19, specifically from the likes of Abhishek Sharma as he hailed his side's display as their best this year.

Rishabh Pant didn't know his own role as LSG captain in IPL 2025: Mohammed KaifMohammed Kaif feels that Rishabh Pant didn't know his own role as the skipper of LSG after his struggles with the bat continued on Monday, April 19. Pant was dismissed for just 7 runs during the match at the Ekana stadium.

US Open's Ashe Stadium to undergo 800 million dollars transformationThe United States Tennis Association has self-funded the massive 800 million dollars project to transform and modernise the famed Arthur Ashe Stadium.

Battered Chennai, Rajasthan look to avoid wooden spoon finishIPL 2025, CSK vs RR: MS Dhoni's Chennai Super Kings and Sanju Samson's Rajasthan Royals will be looking for a win in a game that has no bearing as far as qualification for the playoffs is concerned.

MI rope in Bairstow, Gleeson and Asalanka as overseas replacementsMumbai Indians have signed Jonny Bairstow, Richard Gleeson, and Charith Asalanka as overseas replacements for players departing due to national duty. The trio will be available only if MI qualifies for the IPL 2025 playoffs.

The day they killed an Olympic hockey champion: Prithipal SinghOn this day in 1983, three-time Olympic medallist Prithipal Singh was murdered in broad daylight in the sprawling campus of the Punjab Agriculture University, Ludhiana, sending shockwaves throughout the country.

LSG's Digvesh Rathi suspended after on-field spat with Abhishek SharmaLSG's Digvesh Rathi received a one-match suspension and a 50 percent match fee fine after his on-field spat with SRH's Abhishek Sharma, who was also penalised with a 25 percent fine following the heated IPL 2025 exchange.

LSG's Nicholas Pooran fumes in dressing room after costly run-out vs SRHLSG star batter Nicholas Pooran was seen furious after his run-out in the final over. His reaction reflected LSG's heartbreak as SRH chased down the 206-run target and ended LSG's IPL 2025 playoff hopes.

Losing close games made the difference: Marsh on LSG's IPL 2025 exitIPL 2025: Mitchell Marsh said that Lucknow Super Giants were not helped in their campaign after losing close matches. On Monday, LSG made an exit from the tournament after their six-wicket defeat to the Sunrisers Hyderabad.

MI rope in Bairstow, Gleeson and Asalanka as overseas replacementsMumbai Indians have signed Jonny Bairstow, Richard Gleeson, and Charith Asalanka as overseas replacements for players departing due to national duty. The trio will be available only if MI qualifies for the IPL 2025 playoffs.

The day they killed an Olympic hockey champion: Prithipal SinghOn this day in 1983, three-time Olympic medallist Prithipal Singh was murdered in broad daylight in the sprawling campus of the Punjab Agriculture University, Ludhiana, sending shockwaves throughout the country.

LSG's Digvesh Rathi suspended after on-field spat with Abhishek SharmaLSG's Digvesh Rathi received a one-match suspension and a 50 percent match fee fine after his on-field spat with SRH's Abhishek Sharma, who was also penalised with a 25 percent fine following the heated IPL 2025 exchange.

LSG's Nicholas Pooran fumes in dressing room after costly run-out vs SRHLSG star batter Nicholas Pooran was seen furious after his run-out in the final over. His reaction reflected LSG's heartbreak as SRH chased down the 206-run target and ended LSG's IPL 2025 playoff hopes.

Losing close games made the difference: Marsh on LSG's IPL 2025 exitIPL 2025: Mitchell Marsh said that Lucknow Super Giants were not helped in their campaign after losing close matches. On Monday, LSG made an exit from the tournament after their six-wicket defeat to the Sunrisers Hyderabad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
